values.description:
The debian build system supports `dh_missing` commands inside `rules` files to list the missing files from packages.

To automatically enable it for all builds I did not find a different way that force the standards behaviour in `debian/compat` to level 12 \(only present in bionic and above\) that use the list missing files by default. This way we don't need to modify all the `-release`repos.

The parsing code makes the build to be marked as unstable but still uploads the packages.

‌

Tested here:

![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ign-rendering2-debbuilder&build=13)
[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-rendering2-debbuilder/13/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-rendering2-debbuilder/13)

After fixing the missing files:

![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ign-rendering2-debbuilder&build=14)
[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-rendering2-debbuilder/14/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-rendering2-debbuilder/14/))
values.title: Mark deb builder runs as unstable if some files are not being packaged

summary.raw:
The debian build system supports `dh_missing` commands inside `rules` files to list the missing files from packages.

To automatically enable it for all builds I did not find a different way that force the standards behaviour in `debian/compat` to level 12 \(only present in bionic and above\) that use the list missing files by default. This way we don't need to modify all the `-release`repos.

The parsing code makes the build to be marked as unstable but still uploads the packages.

‌

Tested here:

![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ign-rendering2-debbuilder&build=13)
[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-rendering2-debbuilder/13/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-rendering2-debbuilder/13)

After fixing the missing files:

![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ign-rendering2-debbuilder&build=14)
[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-rendering2-debbuilder/14/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-rendering2-debbuilder/14/))
summary.html:
The debian build system supports dh_missing commands inside rules files to list the missing files from packages.

To automatically enable it for all builds I did not find a different way that force the standards behaviour in debian/compat to level 12 (only present in bionic and above) that use the list missing files by default. This way we don't need to modify all the -releaserepos.

The parsing code makes the build to be marked as unstable but still uploads the packages.

‌

Tested here:

https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-rendering2-debbuilder/13/

After fixing the missing files:

https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-rendering2-debbuilder/14/)

values.description:
Currently the comparison between nightlies with the same timestamp falls into the random factor of VCS revision hash. Not trivial to generate a new nightly with the same timestamp that always superseed the previous one.

With this change we introduce `RELEASE_VERSION` not only for changes in packaging metadata but also to be relevant in the version comparison that changes from: `${UPSTREAM_VERSION}+${TIMESTAMP}r${REV}{UPSTREAM_VERSION}+${TIMESTAMP}+${RELEASE_VERSION}r${REV}`

This way bumping the `RELEASE_VERSION` always generate a greater package than previous even if the `REV` hash is alphabetically lower.

Tested here: [https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-cmake2-debbuilder/71/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-cmake2-debbuilder/71/)
values.title: Use RELEASE_VERSION in nightly to generate versions with same timestamp

summary.raw:
Currently the comparison between nightlies with the same timestamp falls into the random factor of VCS revision hash. Not trivial to generate a new nightly with the same timestamp that always superseed the previous one.

With this change we introduce `RELEASE_VERSION` not only for changes in packaging metadata but also to be relevant in the version comparison that changes from: `${UPSTREAM_VERSION}+${TIMESTAMP}r${REV}{UPSTREAM_VERSION}+${TIMESTAMP}+${RELEASE_VERSION}r${REV}`

This way bumping the `RELEASE_VERSION` always generate a greater package than previous even if the `REV` hash is alphabetically lower.

Tested here: [https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-cmake2-debbuilder/71/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-cmake2-debbuilder/71/)
summary.html:
Currently the comparison between nightlies with the same timestamp falls into the random factor of VCS revision hash. Not trivial to generate a new nightly with the same timestamp that always superseed the previous one.

With this change we introduce RELEASE_VERSION not only for changes in packaging metadata but also to be relevant in the version comparison that changes from: ${UPSTREAM_VERSION}+${TIMESTAMP}r${REV}{UPSTREAM_VERSION}+${TIMESTAMP}+${RELEASE_VERSION}r${REV}

This way bumping the RELEASE_VERSION always generate a greater package than previous even if the REV hash is alphabetically lower.

Tested here: https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-cmake2-debbuilder/71/

values.description:
The following pull request demonstrates a benchmark test in ign-physics:

https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/pull-requests/84/simple-port-of-existing-performance-test/diff

It fails with only the stable repos:

[![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_physics-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64&build=278)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_physics-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/278/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_physics-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/278/

but it passes with this branch, using the nightly repos

[![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_physics-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64&build=279)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_physics-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/279/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_physics-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/279/

values.description: I just made a release from a relatively fresh docker container that didn't have `git` installed, and it didn't have a configuration for a mercurial username. It took a little while to debug that, so I've added better error messages for these cases.
values.title: release.py: better error messages on fresh systems

summary.raw: I just made a release from a relatively fresh docker container that didn't have `git` installed, and it didn't have a configuration for a mercurial username. It took a little while to debug that, so I've added better error messages for these cases.
summary.html: I just made a release from a relatively fresh docker container that didn't have git installed, and it didn't have a configuration for a mercurial username. It took a little while to debug that, so I've added better error messages for these cases.

values.description: I noticed that the homebrew builds were only running one at a time, which often left an idle node. I noticed that the `concurrentBuild` configuration was not enabled for homebrew jobs, and figured out where it is set in the dsl. I think if we just move the configuration from the LinuxBase to UNIXBase it should apply to both.
values.title: dsl: allow concurrent osx builds by moving configuration from OSRFLinuxBase to OSRFUNIXBase

summary.raw: I noticed that the homebrew builds were only running one at a time, which often left an idle node. I noticed that the `concurrentBuild` configuration was not enabled for homebrew jobs, and figured out where it is set in the dsl. I think if we just move the configuration from the LinuxBase to UNIXBase it should apply to both.
summary.html: I noticed that the homebrew builds were only running one at a time, which often left an idle node. I noticed that the concurrentBuild configuration was not enabled for homebrew jobs, and figured out where it is set in the dsl. I think if we just move the configuration from the LinuxBase to UNIXBase it should apply to both.

values.description:
There are currently some problems with the compilation of gazebo9 since vcpkg protobuf and qt libraries are getting somehow into the compilation mix [resulting in a conflict](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_windows/job/gazebo-ci-gazebo9-windows7-amd64/113/consoleFull#5493443676ea37b8d-a6d4-40ae-8431-d90c018842af) with the tarballs used there.

Before spending more time investigating how them are getting into the mix \(even if the integration of vcpkg is disabled\) let’s remove the vcpkg packages to get the things back to work:

![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=gazebo-ci-gazebo9-windows7-amd64&build=116)
[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-gazebo9-windows7-amd64/116/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-gazebo9-windows7-amd64/116/))
values.title: Uninstall vcpkg protobuf and qt before compile gazebo classic

summary.raw:
There are currently some problems with the compilation of gazebo9 since vcpkg protobuf and qt libraries are getting somehow into the compilation mix [resulting in a conflict](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_windows/job/gazebo-ci-gazebo9-windows7-amd64/113/consoleFull#5493443676ea37b8d-a6d4-40ae-8431-d90c018842af) with the tarballs used there.

Before spending more time investigating how them are getting into the mix \(even if the integration of vcpkg is disabled\) let’s remove the vcpkg packages to get the things back to work:

![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=gazebo-ci-gazebo9-windows7-amd64&build=116)
[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-gazebo9-windows7-amd64/116/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-gazebo9-windows7-amd64/116/))
summary.html:
There are currently some problems with the compilation of gazebo9 since vcpkg protobuf and qt libraries are getting somehow into the compilation mix resulting in a conflict with the tarballs used there.

Before spending more time investigating how them are getting into the mix (even if the integration of vcpkg is disabled) let’s remove the vcpkg packages to get the things back to work:

https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-gazebo9-windows7-amd64/116/)

Update ign launch dependencies

values.description:
There was a bug in the dockerfile generation, not scaping the PATH and LD\_LIBRARY\_PATH variables when using nvidia-docker. That was kill the previous paths set and leaving only the nvidia paths.

That was making the [AWS jenkins jobs to fail because](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-gazebo10-xenial-amd64-gpu-nvidia_test_drogon/2/console) it can not find /sbin, used by locale-gen.

[Fixed](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-gazebo10-xenial-amd64-gpu-nvidia_test_drogon/14/) with this PR. Also tested in old nodes, [r2d2.](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_rendering-ci-default-bionic-amd64_test_drogon/6/console)
values.title: Keep PATHs when nvidia-docker is being used

summary.raw:
There was a bug in the dockerfile generation, not scaping the PATH and LD\_LIBRARY\_PATH variables when using nvidia-docker. That was kill the previous paths set and leaving only the nvidia paths.

That was making the [AWS jenkins jobs to fail because](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-gazebo10-xenial-amd64-gpu-nvidia_test_drogon/2/console) it can not find /sbin, used by locale-gen.

[Fixed](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-gazebo10-xenial-amd64-gpu-nvidia_test_drogon/14/) with this PR. Also tested in old nodes, [r2d2.](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_rendering-ci-default-bionic-amd64_test_drogon/6/console)
summary.html:
There was a bug in the dockerfile generation, not scaping the PATH and LD_LIBRARY_PATH variables when using nvidia-docker. That was kill the previous paths set and leaving only the nvidia paths.

That was making the AWS jenkins jobs to fail because it can not find /sbin, used by locale-gen.

Fixed with this PR. Also tested in old nodes, r2d2.

values.description:
I fixed some ABI builds in pull request #834, but ign-physics was still broken. I've made two changes to fix the build and one change to speed it up.

* 1st fix: use c++17 if USE_GCC8 is true. The physics jobs were failing with error logs complaining about c++17 types (see https://gist.github.com/scpeters/5c3dd97591a3f06ab127a2efb9a2ff1a)
* 2nd fix: retry abi checker script with `-quick` if it doesn't generate a report. It seems to run out of memory in the normal mode, but setting `-quick` causes it to "[disable check of some template instances](https://github.com/lvc/abi-compliance-checker/blob/master/abi-compliance-checker.pl#L708-L709)", which appears to be enough to fix the ign-physics build.
* speed thing up by not building the tests

it passed with r2d2: [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_physics-abichecker-any_to_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64&build=83)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_physics-abichecker-any_to_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/83/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_physics-abichecker-any_to_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/83/

but drogon seems to always get disconnected when running this job: [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_physics-abichecker-any_to_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64&build=82)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_physics-abichecker-any_to_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/82/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_physics-abichecker-any_to_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/82/
values.title: Fix and speed up ign-physics ABI builds

summary.raw:
I fixed some ABI builds in pull request #834, but ign-physics was still broken. I've made two changes to fix the build and one change to speed it up.

* 1st fix: use c++17 if USE_GCC8 is true. The physics jobs were failing with error logs complaining about c++17 types (see https://gist.github.com/scpeters/5c3dd97591a3f06ab127a2efb9a2ff1a)
* 2nd fix: retry abi checker script with `-quick` if it doesn't generate a report. It seems to run out of memory in the normal mode, but setting `-quick` causes it to "[disable check of some template instances](https://github.com/lvc/abi-compliance-checker/blob/master/abi-compliance-checker.pl#L708-L709)", which appears to be enough to fix the ign-physics build.
* speed thing up by not building the tests

it passed with r2d2: [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_physics-abichecker-any_to_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64&build=83)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_physics-abichecker-any_to_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/83/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_physics-abichecker-any_to_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/83/

but drogon seems to always get disconnected when running this job: [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_physics-abichecker-any_to_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64&build=82)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_physics-abichecker-any_to_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/82/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_physics-abichecker-any_to_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/82/
summary.html:
I fixed some ABI builds in pull request #834, but ign-physics was still broken. I've made two changes to fix the build and one change to speed it up.

  • 1st fix: use c++17 if USE_GCC8 is true. The physics jobs were failing with error logs complaining about c++17 types (see https://gist.github.com/scpeters/5c3dd97591a3f06ab127a2efb9a2ff1a)
  • 2nd fix: retry abi checker script with -quick if it doesn't generate a report. It seems to run out of memory in the normal mode, but setting -quick causes it to "disable check of some template instances", which appears to be enough to fix the ign-physics build.
  • speed thing up by not building the tests

it passed with r2d2: https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_physics-abichecker-any_to_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/83/

but drogon seems to always get disconnected when running this job: https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_physics-abichecker-any_to_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/82/

values.description:
DSL is failing since my last update to 1.74 version. The reason is that DSL removed the `label` field. 

![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=_dsl_ignition&build=840)
[https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/\_dsl\_ignition/840/\)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/_dsl_ignition/840/))

I think that we are fine removing it since the pipelines used `node` declarations to set where a job should be run. Our code [already have this configuration in place](#!/osrf/release-tools/src/f10bfb6d345a12b5366d9b250bdf8b9e534d9be7/jenkins-scripts/dsl/_configs_/OSRFCIWorkFlow.groovy#lines-76).
values.title: Remove deprecated/removed DSL label

[https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/\_dsl\_ignition/840/\)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/_dsl_ignition/840/))

I think that we are fine removing it since the pipelines used `node` declarations to set where a job should be run. Our code [already have this configuration in place](#!/osrf/release-tools/src/f10bfb6d345a12b5366d9b250bdf8b9e534d9be7/jenkins-scripts/dsl/_configs_/OSRFCIWorkFlow.groovy#lines-76).
summary.html:
DSL is failing since my last update to 1.74 version. The reason is that DSL removed the label field.

https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/_dsl_ignition/840/))

I think that we are fine removing it since the pipelines used node declarations to set where a job should be run. Our code already have this configuration in place.

values.description:
The ign-gazebo bionic builds haven't been running GPU tests because they can't find the a DRI display: 

* https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/ign-blueprint/job/ignition_gazebo-ci-ign-gazebo2-bionic-amd64/6/consoleFull

~~~
-- Looking for display capabilities
-- Could not find 'xwininfo', which is needed for FindDRI. Please install the package 'x11-utils'
-- Skipping these INTEGRATION tests because a valid display was not found:
--  depth_camera.cc
--  gpu_lidar.cc
--  sensors_system.cc
~~~

This adds `x11-utils` to `BASE_DEPENDENCIES` to make sure they are installed.

Test build with 4 new tests that ran:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_gazebo-ci-ign-gazebo2-bionic-amd64&build=7)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/ign-blueprint/job/ignition_gazebo-ci-ign-gazebo2-bionic-amd64/7/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/ign-blueprint/job/ignition_gazebo-ci-ign-gazebo2-bionic-amd64/7/testReport/(root)/

~~~
-- Looking for display capabilities
--  + found a display available ($DISPLAY is set)
--  + found a valid dri display (glxinfo)
~~~

-- Looking for display capabilities

values.description:
Replace the installation of [packages.osrfoundation.org](http://packages.osrfoundation.org) repository \(sources.list and add key\) on Linux to use the [feature added to gazebo developers tool ](https://github.com/osrf/gzdev/pull/6)\(see [README](https://github.com/osrf/gzdev/blob/e142b472eaec895b7ced7fe538f106fff04d72b7/README.md)\).

The goal is to have a single tool for installing the appropriate repositories \(stable, prerelease, nightly\) with a s[ingle point of configuration](https://github.com/osrf/gzdev/blob/e142b472eaec895b7ced7fe538f106fff04d72b7/plugins/config/repository.yaml) that can serve in our different CI services \(bitbucket-pipelines, travis or jenkins\).

The tool can work using [the configuration file](https://github.com/osrf/gzdev/blob/e142b472eaec895b7ced7fe538f106fff04d72b7/plugins/config/repository.yaml#L14), variable `GZDEV_PROJECT_NAME`, or if the variable is not present, by doing simple calls \(i.e: `gzdev repository enable osrf prerelease)` I migrated most of the compilation jobs to use configuration but left others to use single calls \([logic added here to dockerfiles](#!/osrf/release-tools/pull-requests/new#Ljenkins-scripts/docker/lib/docker_generate_dockerfile.bashT32)\).

Testing:

* ignition-gazebo2 using configuration stable \+ prerelease:

    * ![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_gazebo-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64&build=1800)
    
        [https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition\_gazebo-ci-pr\_any-ubuntu\_auto-amd64/1800/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gazebo-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/1800/))

    
    
* sdformat install using no configuration but single calls

    * ![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/sdformat-install-sdformat8_pkg-bionic-amd64/260/badge/icon)
    
        [https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/sdformat-install-sdformat8\_pkg-bionic-amd64/260/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/sdformat-install-sdformat8_pkg-bionic-amd64/260/))

    
    
* travis in sdformat repo 

    * [https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/commits/85d2e377544df22713588b174669d27f222c5ed8](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/commits/85d2e377544df22713588b174669d27f222c5ed8)
values.title: Use gzdev tool to install repositories

summary.raw:
Replace the installation of [packages.osrfoundation.org](http://packages.osrfoundation.org) repository \(sources.list and add key\) on Linux to use the [feature added to gazebo developers tool ](https://github.com/osrf/gzdev/pull/6)\(see [README](https://github.com/osrf/gzdev/blob/e142b472eaec895b7ced7fe538f106fff04d72b7/README.md)\).

The goal is to have a single tool for installing the appropriate repositories \(stable, prerelease, nightly\) with a s[ingle point of configuration](https://github.com/osrf/gzdev/blob/e142b472eaec895b7ced7fe538f106fff04d72b7/plugins/config/repository.yaml) that can serve in our different CI services \(bitbucket-pipelines, travis or jenkins\).

The tool can work using [the configuration file](https://github.com/osrf/gzdev/blob/e142b472eaec895b7ced7fe538f106fff04d72b7/plugins/config/repository.yaml#L14), variable `GZDEV_PROJECT_NAME`, or if the variable is not present, by doing simple calls \(i.e: `gzdev repository enable osrf prerelease)` I migrated most of the compilation jobs to use configuration but left others to use single calls \([logic added here to dockerfiles](#!/osrf/release-tools/pull-requests/new#Ljenkins-scripts/docker/lib/docker_generate_dockerfile.bashT32)\).

Testing:

* ignition-gazebo2 using configuration stable \+ prerelease:

    * ![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_gazebo-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64&build=1800)
    
        [https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition\_gazebo-ci-pr\_any-ubuntu\_auto-amd64/1800/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gazebo-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/1800/))

    
    
* sdformat install using no configuration but single calls

    * ![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/sdformat-install-sdformat8_pkg-bionic-amd64/260/badge/icon)
    
        [https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/sdformat-install-sdformat8\_pkg-bionic-amd64/260/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/sdformat-install-sdformat8_pkg-bionic-amd64/260/))

    
    
* travis in sdformat repo 

    * [https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/commits/85d2e377544df22713588b174669d27f222c5ed8](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/commits/85d2e377544df22713588b174669d27f222c5ed8)
summary.html:
Replace the installation of packages.osrfoundation.org repository (sources.list and add key) on Linux to use the feature added to gazebo developers tool (see README).

The goal is to have a single tool for installing the appropriate repositories (stable, prerelease, nightly) with a single point of configuration that can serve in our different CI services (bitbucket-pipelines, travis or jenkins).

The tool can work using the configuration file, variable GZDEV_PROJECT_NAME, or if the variable is not present, by doing simple calls (i.e: gzdev repository enable osrf prerelease) I migrated most of the compilation jobs to use configuration but left others to use single calls (logic added here to dockerfiles).

Testing:

  • ignition-gazebo2 using configuration stable + prerelease:

    • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gazebo-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/1800/)

  • sdformat install using no configuration but single calls

    • https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/sdformat-install-sdformat8_pkg-bionic-amd64/260/)

  • travis in sdformat repo

    • https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/commits/85d2e377544df22713588b174669d27f222c5ed8

values.description:
* This PR implements the test of gazebo packages directly from the Ubuntu repositories without using any of our repositories.

    The test includes a quick runtime run to detect major problems. The problem with the ignition URL change \(reported originally by @{557058:e2bf789f-2138-4a4e-ba39-3d618078e20b} \) appears [in the build log](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/gazebo-install_ubuntu_official-gazebo9_pkg-bionic-amd64/8/parsed_console).



    Testing:



    * The official Ubuntu packages:
    
        ![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=gazebo-install_ubuntu_official-gazebo9_pkg-bionic-amd64&build=8)
    
        [https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/gazebo-install\_ubuntu\_official-gazebo9\_pkg-bionic-amd64/8/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/gazebo-install_ubuntu_official-gazebo9_pkg-bionic-amd64/8/)

    
    * gazebo9 from our repositories:
    
        ![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=gazebo-install-gazebo9_pkg-xenial-amd64&build=525)
    
        [https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/gazebo-install-gazebo9\_pkg-xenial-amd64/525/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/gazebo-install-gazebo9_pkg-xenial-amd64/525/)

values.description:
This PR should avoid problems with timing in the smoke test of Gazebo. Those problems were present [in this build](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-install_ubuntu_official-gazebo7_pkg-xenial-amd64/7/consoleFull#58390426331ee8289-5b13-4660-aeff-4eeabda42591) of gazebo7.

The PR also includes a change to avoid ALSA errors on gazebo runs \([like in this run](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-install_ubuntu_official-gazebo9_pkg-bionic-amd64/13/consoleFull#-52552005831ee8289-5b13-4660-aeff-4eeabda42591)\) mapping /dev/snd inside the container.

Final tests:

**gazebo7**

![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=gazebo-install_ubuntu_official-gazebo7_pkg-xenial-amd64&build=9)
[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-install\_ubuntu\_official-gazebo7\_pkg-xenial-amd64/9/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-install_ubuntu_official-gazebo7_pkg-xenial-amd64/9/))

**gazebo9**

![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=gazebo-install_ubuntu_official-gazebo9_pkg-bionic-amd64&build=14)
[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-install\_ubuntu\_official-gazebo9\_pkg-bionic-amd64/14/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-install_ubuntu_official-gazebo9_pkg-bionic-amd64/14/))

error is ok because the URL for the api of fueltools is broken.
values.title: Install gz models before gazebo runtime test

summary.raw:
This PR should avoid problems with timing in the smoke test of Gazebo. Those problems were present [in this build](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-install_ubuntu_official-gazebo7_pkg-xenial-amd64/7/consoleFull#58390426331ee8289-5b13-4660-aeff-4eeabda42591) of gazebo7.

The PR also includes a change to avoid ALSA errors on gazebo runs \([like in this run](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-install_ubuntu_official-gazebo9_pkg-bionic-amd64/13/consoleFull#-52552005831ee8289-5b13-4660-aeff-4eeabda42591)\) mapping /dev/snd inside the container.

Final tests:

**gazebo7**

![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=gazebo-install_ubuntu_official-gazebo7_pkg-xenial-amd64&build=9)
[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-install\_ubuntu\_official-gazebo7\_pkg-xenial-amd64/9/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-install_ubuntu_official-gazebo7_pkg-xenial-amd64/9/))

**gazebo9**

![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=gazebo-install_ubuntu_official-gazebo9_pkg-bionic-amd64&build=14)
[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-install\_ubuntu\_official-gazebo9\_pkg-bionic-amd64/14/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-install_ubuntu_official-gazebo9_pkg-bionic-amd64/14/))

error is ok because the URL for the api of fueltools is broken.
summary.html:
This PR should avoid problems with timing in the smoke test of Gazebo. Those problems were present in this build of gazebo7.

The PR also includes a change to avoid ALSA errors on gazebo runs (like in this run) mapping /dev/snd inside the container.

Final tests:

gazebo7

https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-install_ubuntu_official-gazebo7_pkg-xenial-amd64/9/)

gazebo9

https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-install_ubuntu_official-gazebo9_pkg-bionic-amd64/14/)

error is ok because the URL for the api of fueltools is broken.
